conclusion: Determine how the number of molecules colliding with the unit area of the wall per unit time changes from state C to state D.
Stirling cycle with states A, B, C, and D; process C→D is isothermal; pressure increases and volume decreases from C to D.
Collision rate Z is given by Z = (1/4) n ̅v, where n is number density and ̅v is average molecular speed.
During C→D, volume decreases, total number of molecules remains constant, so number density n increases.
Average molecular speed ̅v is related to temperature by ̅v = sqrt(8kT/πm).
Since C→D is isothermal, temperature T remains constant, so ̅v remains constant.
Collision rate Z increases because n increases and ̅v remains constant.
From state C to D, the number of molecules colliding with the unit area of the wall per unit time increases.
